subject: Travel
title: Petra: Carved Into Cliffs
description: A 60-second lesson on Petra: Carved Into Cliffs.

hook.text: A city carved entirely from rose-red sandstone cliffs was lost to the Western world for 500 years.

buildup.text: The Nabataeans built Petra in modern Jordan as a trading hub between Arabia, Egypt, and the Mediterranean.

discovery.text: Swiss explorer Johann Burckhardt disguised himself as an Arab pilgrim and rediscovered Petra in 1812.

twist.text: Only 15% of Petra has been excavated. The vast majority of the city remains buried underground.

climax.text: Petra became a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders. Tourism now sustains the region.

punchline.text: 85% of the city is still underground, waiting to be found.

quiz.question: How much of Petra has been excavated?
